topics.body:
*Thud

*speaking while face has made a crater in my desk to which I'll need the jaws of life to remove me from*

So in case you've missed it the GOP are trying to impeach Obama and didn't really give a reason to until they had already tried to start the process to impeach him. . Anyways they have decided on what to sue him over; they're suing him for delaying the provision of the ACA saying that people have to have health insurance.  So they're essentially suing him over delaying a bill they hate.  It's official congress has a chronic case of stupidity.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c05aa56368723547cf0600#post_53c05aa56368723547cf0600
That's the only explanation.  I think they finally realized that they can no longer exist in the long run run since the younger generations are vast majority democrats and the majority of their core voter base are probably going to start dying of old age in the next couple of years.



You know that does raise a question though; when the republican party dies/as it is now dies what will happen?  What I mean by this is that even if the republican party does maintain to some level members in congress groups like social conservatism, the religious right and the tea party are fucked.

The most obvious outcome is that glbt rights will be unopposed, but what else will change?  Imagine the usa without the religious right, social conservatives or the tea party having any political power or say in politics.
